objdescid.compdate: 1807The work is signed and dated "1807 WBlake inv" bottom right.

objinfo.leafsize: approximately 49.0 x 40.0 cm.A small strip of paper, 0.7 cm., has been added along the bottom margin.
objinfo.medium: pen and ink, water color, with some scratching out

provenance.name: Victoria and Albert Museum
provenance.note: Acquired from Blake at an unknown date (1807 or later) by Thomas Butts; inherited in 1845 by Thomas Butts, Jr.; sold from the Butts collection, Foster and Son auction, London, 29 June 1853, lot 89 (£6.6s. to William Stirling-Maxwell); Archibald Stirling, probably by inheritance in 1878; William Stirling, probably by inheritance in 1931; sold 1953 by W. Stirling to the Victoria and Albert Museum, London.

objnote.p: [*A Vision of the Last Judgment*](http://www.blakearchive.org/preview/but639), Butlin 639, is about the same size as this work and may be a companion water color to it.
